name: Begonia subnummularifolia
description: Begonia subnummularifolia is a terrestrial plant native to tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and features upright stems (15-30 cm tall) with small, asymmetrical, coin-shaped (subnummularifolia means "almost coin-leaved"), dark green leaves with distinctive patterns, perfect for compact spaces. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Leaves often feature striking patterns including spirals, spots, stripes, and iridescent sheens, with some species having translucent "windows" in their leaves. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive foliage. It's popular among Begonia enthusiasts for its compact size and attractive leaves.
careTips: Keep soil moist but not soggy
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
